results.title: The Circle
results.creator_credit: Mort Ransen, John Kemeny and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Produced in 1967, this black and white film is an inmate’s view of Daytop, a drug treatment center on Staten Island, New York, where addicts learn to get along without drugs. Uncompromising, often brutal group therapy sessions are designed to shake loose the excuses a victim makes for himself. The people and situations shown are authentic; only one actor was employed. The results obtained at Daytop are regarded by some psychiatrists as a breakthrough. Cast: Don Francks.

results.title: The Cinematographer with Enzo Martinelli
results.creator_credit: Bruce Seth Greer and Universal Education and Visual Arts
results.brief_description: Featuring cinematographer Enzo Martinelli whose job it is to interpret the film story photographically and bring a motion picture to life. The film shows how every facet of the operation is handled, how decisions are taken and the work which influences the mood and impact of a picture. The viewer learns about visual styles and techniques which make creative editing possible.

results.title: The Cinematographer
results.brief_description: Directors of photography are members of the American Society of Cinematography. Produecrs and directors rely on them to integrate costumes, make-up, sets, and all production operations. Besides knowing how to operate cameras, lenses, dollies and lighting equipment, cinematographers must be artists in using light in ways most appropriate to the subject. The film includes several illustrative scenes, mostly concerned with lighting problems, from “Picture of Dorian Gray” and “Great Expectations”.

results.title: The Cider House rules
results.creator_credit: Lasse Hallstrom, Richard Gladstein, Miramax Films and Film Colony
results.brief_description: John Irving won an Academy Award for his script to the film which is based on his acclaimed novel of the same name. Set in the lush green landscape of mid-century North East United States, ‘The Cider House rules’ stars Tobey McGuire as Homer, a bright young man who has spent his whole life in St. Cloud’s Orphanage. The institution’s doctor and leader, Wilbur Lynch (Michael Caine), wants Homer to take over his duties in the orphanage. But Homer wants to see more of the world and to experience life outside the safety of St. Clouds. He goes on the road and begins work as a farm-hand in an apple orchard. There he experiences love for the first time, but he is also introduced to the harsh realities of life. Witnessing incest and betrayal for the first time in his life, Homer has to rethink his self-righteous beliefs about single motherhood, adoption and abortion. Though the film deals with controversial subjects and themes, it is a revisionist piece of filmmaking. The sharp lyrical cinematography is by Oliver Stapelton, while Irving’s script and Hallstrom’s direction is classical in structure. But though its mise-en-scene may be nostalgic, in suggesting the darker forces at play in the social order of post-World War II North America, ‘The Cider House rules’ never allows its emotional resonances to slip into sentimentality. The cast is uniformally excellent and Michael Caine won an Academy Award for his performance.

results.title: The Chromosomes of man
results.brief_description: Methods of preparing cells for chromosome study in the laboratory. Photomicrography of cell division shows how chromosomes split and build up two daughter sets with the same number of chromosomes. The film also shows abnormal arrangements and concludes with the analysis used in studies of cancer.

results.title: The Christmas visitor
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Phoenix Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: Presents an animated adaptation of Clement Moore’s poem entitled A visit from St. Nicholas. While Santa is resting, the toys from his bundle burst forth in a flurry of activity and the adventure of Christmas begins.

results.title: The Christmas tree
results.creator_credit: M Tsekhanovsky, P. Nosov and Cartoon Film Studios
results.brief_description: An animated Christmas story for young children, in the Disney style, about the forest animals gathering snow-covered Christmas trees in preparation for the Christmas festivities. Father Christmas in the meantime is driving his sleigh through the forest gathering gifts, only to be hindered by two mean foxes. Fortunately the forest animals come to his aid and to celebrate, Father Christmas waves his magical wand to produce a beautiful large Christmas tree covered with gifts. At the stroke of midnight, all the animals and Father Christmas dance around the tree. Russian dialogue - no subtext.

results.title: The Christmas tree
results.brief_description: This is a traditional Ukrainian folktale, based on a story by Michaelo Kochubinsky, set in the 19th century. The story concerns eleven year old Ivanko, his parents, a mysterious old man and the “special” Christmas tree that tests the family’s faith and draws them together.

results.title: The Christmas tree
results.brief_description: At a special orphanage, the children fall in love with a beautiful pine tree. The evil owner of the orphanage plans to cut down the tree and spoil the children’s holiday. However, Santa keeps watch over the children, hears their Christmas wish and soon all their dreams come true.

results.title: The Christmas dream
results.creator_credit: K Zeman, B Zeman and Czechoslovak Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A fantasy in which a little girl’s toys come to life in a dream - the toys being played by puppets. (The film is noteworthy for the excellence of the puppet animation in the original material - for American distribution introductory and concluding sequences have been added to the film by Castle Films, USA.). Music only - no language.
